      • coalesce

        public <C extends CoalescingStrategies.Coalescable> void coalesce(java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<C> input,
                                                         java.util.List<C> out,
                                                         int maxItems)
              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Drain from the input blocking queue to the output list up to maxItems elements. The coalescing strategy may choose to park the current thread if it thinks it will be able to produce an output list with more elements.
        Parameters:
        input - Blocking queue to retrieve elements from
        out - Output list to place retrieved elements in. Must be empty.
        maxItems - Maximum number of elements to place in the output list
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • coalesceInternal

        protected abstract <C extends CoalescingStrategies.Coalescable> void coalesceInternal(java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<C> input,
                                                                 java.util.List<C> out,
                                                                 int maxItems)
                                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
